intro: Pelaphoides rotundiflora, commonly known as the roundleaf pelaphoides, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its rounded, broad leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowers bloom in the spring and are pollinated primarily by insects. Pelaphoides rotundiflora is valued for its ornamental qualities and has limited use in traditional medicine.
